botanical_details.genus: Chrysanthemum are erect woody-based perennials with aromatic, pinnately lobed leaves and flowerheads of diverse form, from late summer to late autumn
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Reflexed, Early flowering Outdoor Spray chrysanthemums are upright plants with medium-sized, fully double flowerheads, the florets curved outwards from the centre, flowering in late summer and autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a sheltered site in full sun in fertile, well-drained soil enriched with organic matter and general purpose fertiliser. Water freely in dry weather. Pinch out the growing tips when the plants are 15-20cm to encourage bushy, floriferous plants. Staking is usually required. In mild areas the plants can be left in the ground over winter; elsewhere lift the crowns and store in a greenhouse, raising fresh plants from these each year. See staking perennials and chrysanthemum cultivation for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings taken in spring taken from shoots of stored stools
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back to near ground level in the autumn before lifting and storing for winter
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, earwigs ,chrysanthemum eelworms, capsid bugs, leaf miners, glasshouse red spider mite and glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to chrysanthemum white rust, powdery mildews, grey moulds and a virus
